question_title: Will the community prediction be higher than 60.00% on 2026-02-11 for the Metaculus question "Will the United States attack Iran before April 2026?"?
summary: This meta-question asks whether the Metaculus CP for "US attack Iran before April 2026" will exceed 60% on Feb 11. The current CP is 56% (down from 60% on Feb 1), showing strong de-escalation momentum. High-level US-Iran talks are scheduled for Friday Feb 6 in Istanbul, with multiple regional mediators involved. Both sides are signaling willingness to negotiate, with Iran offering nuclear concessions. For CP to rise above 60%, talks would need to fail dramatically or a military incident would occur. Given the diplomatic investment from both sides and 7 regional countries, continued de-escalation is more likely than reversal. The 4-point CP drop in ~1 day suggests forecasters are already pricing in diplomatic progress.

factors.description: CP already dropped from 60% to 56% - needs 4+ point reversal to resolve YES, trend is clearly downward
High-level Witkoff-Araghchi talks scheduled Friday Feb 6 in Istanbul - first talks since June conflict, showing diplomatic momentum
Seven regional FMs (Turkey, Qatar, Egypt, Oman, UAE, Saudi, Pakistan) facilitating - significant investment in preventing conflict
Iran offering nuclear concessions (zero enrichment under consortium) - signals serious engagement
Talks could fail dramatically, spiking strike probability - key uncertainty before resolution
Gap remains on missiles/proxies - Iran says missiles 'never' on table, could cause impasse
USS Abraham Lincoln battle group in position - military option remains live if diplomacy fails
